Extrude face 1 by 0.015 towards the normal and 0.0 in the opposite direction. Scale the sketch by 0.75. This operation results in the creation of a new solid body (NewBodyFeatureOperation). For part 2, construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom offset from part 1. The final shape is a simple, white, three-dimensional shape with a flat base and a triangular top. Part 1 has dimensions of approximately 0.75 x 0.75 x 0.015 units, and part 2 has dimensions of approximately 0.735 x 0.735 x 0.015 units. The height is determined by the extrusion depth, while the length and width are determined by the scale of the sketch.</description>

Create a new sketch on a planar face perpendicular to the Z axis that contains the origin of the new coordinate system. 2. Draw two concentric circles in this sketch as follows: - The inner circle has a radius of 0.0238 units and is centered at the origin. - The outer circle has a radius of 0.6129 units and is centered at (0.5891, 0). 3. Close the loop and complete the sketch. Cut the sketch by 0.0952 units along the negative Z direction. **Part 3** Create a second cylindrical hole at the center of the prism. Create a new sketch on a planar face perpendicular to the Z axis that contains the origin of the new coordinate system. 2. Close the loop and complete the sketch. Cut the sketch by 0.0952 units along the negative Z direction. The final shape of this assembly is a three-dimensional rectangular prism with two cylindrical holes in the center, a flat top and bottom, parallel sides, and perpendicular top and bottom faces. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units by 4 units by 6 units. Each cylindrical hole has a height of 0.6129 units, a diameter of 0.0952 units (radius of 0.0476 units), and is centered in the prism.</description>
